plugins.name: Smart Frame Organizer
plugins.description:
Smart Frame Tools helps you organize, duplicate, align, and rename frames in seconds — no dragging, no chaos.


Designed for precision layouts, this plugin includes smart features to:


Automatically rename frames left-to-right, top-to-bottom


Align selected frames into clean grids


Enforce consistent horizontal spacing


Duplicate and insert frames intelligently with automatic renaming


Perfect for UI designers, developers, and anyone working with structured layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Smart Frame Tools — Precision layout. Effortless control.

plugins.name: TagScout
plugins.description:
Who even has the time to name every rectangles, right?


🎦 See How it Works


TagScout is here to boost your Figma workflow so you can focus on what really matters.


With TagScout, you can:


🏷️ Tag anything:

Add custom tags to frames, layers, or groups for quick reference.


🔍 Find instantly:

Search and jump to any tagged element in seconds, even across pages.


🚀 Stay organised:

Keep your files tidy and your workflow efficient, no matter how complex the project.


Stop wasting time scrolling and start designing smarter. TagScout helps you save hours and keep your creative flow intact.


Try it now and see the difference!

plugins.name: Frames by Names
plugins.description:
Frames by Names is your new Figma sidekick!


Tired of manually creating and naming frames one by one? Just paste in your list of names, pick your desired frame size and letter case style (or keep it original), and watch as your canvas magically fills with neatly organized frames right where you're looking.


Whether you're brainstorming, organizing, or just having fun with names, this plugin makes design setup quick and playful. Say hello to effortless layouts and goodbye to tedious frame creation—let Frames by Names bring order (and a dash of whimsy) to your Figma workflow!

accepted.name: Pragmatics Studio
accepted.description: We believe that design is most beautiful when it works. We’re here to co-create and empower your team with design and creative problem solving.

plugins.tagline: Paste a list of names, choose the frame size, and watch frames appear in view.

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

110619.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
110619.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.

plugins.name: Move Outside
plugins.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the page’s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
plugins.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

106901.name: Move Outside
106901.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the page’s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
106901.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

plugins.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
plugins.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

accepted.name: Luis Ouriach
accepted.description:
Design & community @figmadesign. I write a newsletter, manage and host @8pxmag. 

Hot sauce on everything.

plugins.tagline: Copy, paste, generate

135698.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
135698.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

plugins.name: Material Design Icons (MDI)
plugins.description:
Access to thousands of Material Design Icons — Instantly elevate your design workflow with a complete, up-to-date library of Material Design Icons, right inside Figma!


🎨 Fully customizable – Change size, color, and stroke directly within Figma to match your project’s style effortlessly.


🔍 Powerful search – Find exactly the icon you need in seconds with intelligent keyword-based filtering.


🧩 Organized categories – Browse icons by category (e.g., navigation, social, UI elements) for faster discovery and inspiration.


⚡ One-click insert – Drop icons into your design with a single click—no need to leave Figma or download external assets.


🛠️ Perfect for UI/UX designers – Maintain design consistency and follow Google’s Material Design guidelines with pixel-perfect icons.


🌐 Always up to date – Get the latest MDI icons automatically—no manual updates required.


✨ Whether you're designing apps, websites, or dashboards, the MDI Library plugin gives you everything you need to work smarter and design faster.

plugins.name: Heurator
plugins.description:
Elevate your design critique process with Heurator, a powerful Figma plugin that brings Nielsen's 10 Usability Heuristics directly into your workflow.


Document, visualize, and solve usability issues with precision—all without leaving your design files.


✓ Pinpoint violations with customizable severity ratings

✓ Generate visually striking evaluation cards linked to problem areas

✓ Create actionable recommendations to improve user experience

✓ Maintain consistent evaluation criteria across your team


Even in the age of AI-generated interfaces, human-centered heuristic evaluation remains essential. While AI excels at creating visually appealing designs, it often misses nuanced usability concerns that experienced designers catch. Heurator bridges this gap by helping you apply proven principles to any interface—whether human or AI-designed—ensuring truly intuitive experiences.


Transform complex usability principles into practical insights and deliver more thoughtful, user-centered designs with Heurator.
plugins.tagline: Because Even AI-Generated UIs Need Human-Centered Evaluation

plugins.name: Syntax Manager
plugins.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes – done!
plugins.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

130750.description:

130750.release_notes:
New Features:
- Inline syntax editing – Click directly on syntax values to edit them instantly.
- Prefix dropdown – Choose how templates are applied: Auto, Name, or Syntax mode.
- Multiple replacements – Use ; to apply several find/replace patterns in one step.

Enhancements:
- UI improvements for better clarity and usability
- Various bug fixes for a smoother, more reliable experience
130750.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

plugins.name: QR Code Generator
plugins.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they don’t rely on our service and they’re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.
plugins.tagline: Create QR codes without leaving Figma

126163.name: QR Code Generator
126163.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they don’t rely on our service and they’re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin requires network access to RecodeQR's API to generate QR codes. No user data is stored.

126163.release_notes: Fixed dark mode, improve community details
126163.tagline: Create QR codes without leaving Figma

plugins.name: Hot Spot
plugins.description:
“Hot Spot” is a Figma plugin that recognizes objects and human faces within image nodes to enable smart image cropping.

The detection process uses TensorFlow machine learning models and is fast with the power of Worker and WASM (WebAssembly).


***** This plugin is a one-time paid plugin, with up to 10 times trial available. *****


👉 Check out the details on Hot Spot Website.

🔑 You can buy a License Key on Gumroad.



//



“Hot Spot”は画像ノードに含まれるオブジェクトや顔（人間）を検出しスマートな画像切り抜きを実現するFigmaプラグインです。

検出処理はTensorFlowの機械学習モデルを利用し、WorkerとWASM (WebAssembly) のパワーで高速に行われます。


***** このプラグインは1回払いの有料プラグインで、10回までのトライアルが可能です。 *****


👉 詳しくは Hot Spot ウェブサイト をご覧ください。

plugins.tagline: Smart Image Cropping Tool powered by Object & Face Detection

128608.name: Hot Spot
128608.description:
“Hot Spot” is a Figma plugin that recognizes objects and human faces within image nodes to enable smart image cropping.

The detection process uses TensorFlow machine learning models and is fast with the power of Worker and WASM (WebAssembly).


***** This plugin is a one-time paid plugin, with up to 10 times trial available. *****


👉 Check out the details on Hot Spot Website.

🔑 You can buy a License Key on Gumroad.



//



“Hot Spot”は画像ノードに含まれるオブジェクトや顔（人間）を検出しスマートな画像切り抜きを実現するFigmaプラグインです。

検出処理はTensorFlowの機械学習モデルを利用し、WorkerとWASM (WebAssembly) のパワーで高速に行われます。


***** このプラグインは1回払いの有料プラグインで、10回までのトライアルが可能です。 *****


👉 詳しくは Hot Spot ウェブサイト をご覧ください。

🔑 ライセンスキーは Gumroad でご購入いただけます。
128608.release_notes:
Fixed a bug in the masking process for image nodes placed in frames and components.
フレームやコンポーネント内に配置された画像ノードのマスク処理の不具合を修正しました。
128608.tagline: Smart Image Cropping Tool powered by Object & Face Detection

plugins.name: Asset Dependencies
plugins.description:
Effortlessly manage and visualize your Figma assets with the Asset Dependencies plugin. This powerful tool scans and analyzes your local Figma files, creating a topologically sorted list of all components, subcomponents, dependencies, and usage.


Comprehensive analysis

Automatically scans your Figma assets to identify all components and their relationships.


Topological sorting

Generates a clear, topologically sorted list of components and subcomponents, making it easy to understand dependencies.


Dependency mapping

Visualize which components are used by others, helping you manage and optimize your design system.


Usage insights

See at a glance how and where each component is used across your file.


Export options

Export lists as CSV files to use in other tools.

plugins.name: E-ImageCompression
plugins.description:
E-ImageCompression is a privacy-focused tool that lets you reduce image sizes by up to 90% without sacrificing quality, seamlessly integrated into your workflow.


Your files are never stored on our servers — images are processed securely via the official TinyPNG API and delivered straight back to you.


Batch compress multiple images, preview results, and export everything with a single click.

Perfect for anyone who values speed, security, and high-quality image optimization.
plugins.tagline: Optimize images in one click

137621.name: E-ImageCompression
137621.description:
E-ImageCompression is a privacy-focused tool that lets you reduce image sizes by up to 90% without sacrificing quality, seamlessly integrated into your workflow.


Your files are never stored on our servers — images are processed securely via the official TinyPNG API and delivered straight back to you.


Batch compress multiple images, preview results, and export everything with a single click.

Perfect for anyone who values speed, security, and high-quality image optimization.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin uses TinyPNG API for image compression. Since TinyPNG API doesn't support CORS directly, we use a CORS proxy (cors.siteceterum.ru) for secure API communication.

plugins.name: Tailwind Text Styles Generator
plugins.description:
Tailwind Text Style Generator is a Figma plugin that helps you automatically generate text styles from Google Fonts, based on Tailwind typography scale.


Tired of manually creating text styles and organizing layers one by one? This plugin does it all for you:


🎨 Choose from 1,800+ Google Fonts

📏 Auto-generate Text Styles using Tailwind-friendly sizing (sm, base, lg, xl, etc.)

⚡ Perfect for dev-design alignment especially for teams using Tailwind CSS

📁 Organized neatly: styles are grouped and named by scale

🔁 Try different fonts freely great for experimenting and iterating

💾 Instantly saved into your current design system


Whether you're building a design system or just want to speed up your workflow, this plugin makes it seamless, scalable, and developer-friendly.
plugins.tagline: 1.800 Fonts. 1 Click. Done.

plugins.name: Text Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. It’s easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figma’s menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

• Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layer’s text to "Hello World".


• Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layer’s text to "Welcome".


• Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


• Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


• Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


• Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or you’ll get an error.
plugins.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

135574.name: Text Auto Fill
135574.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. It’s easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figma’s menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

• Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layer’s text to "Hello World".


• Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layer’s text to "Welcome".


• Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


• Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


• Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


• Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or you’ll get an error.
135574.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

plugins.name: Forma
plugins.description:
🎨 FORMA: Design Systems in Minutes, Not Months! 🚀


Ever tried creating a design system from scratch? It's like trying to fold a fitted sheet – seemingly impossible and will probably make you cry. 😭


Forma swoops in to save your sanity with magical design system generation powers:


✨ COLOR SORCERY

• Create gorgeous Pantone-style color palettes

• Generate perfect shades that actually make sense

• Turn chaotic color choices into harmonious design languages


📝 TYPOGRAPHY WIZARDRY

• Conjure complete typography hierarchies faster than you can say "Comic Sans is unacceptable"

• 9 perfectly balanced text styles that your design lead will actually approve

• Font fallbacks that won't make your developers rage-quit


🧩 DESIGN TOKENS

• Spacing systems that maintain mathematical harmony

• Size tokens that scale beautifully across devices

• Consistent radius values (because inconsistent corner radii are criminal)


⚠️ BETA ALERT ⚠️

This release is a preview of Forma's powers - not for production just yet! We're still brewing up more magical features like component generation, brand voice integration, and design consistency checks.


Created with ❤️ (and a lot of coffee) by a designer who got tired of rebuilding the same foundations over and over again.
plugins.tagline: Design System Generator

plugins.name: Prism by lumos
plugins.description:
🌈 Prism by Lumos


A smarter way to manage your Figma color variables


Prism is a powerful, easy-to-use plugin built to help you create, organize, and maintain a clean, scalable color system in Figma. Whether you’re building from scratch or refining an existing system, Prism takes the heavy lifting out of color management.


It’s the same powerful tool we use to power the Lumos Design System — with token-based color management built right in.


⸻


✨ What Prism does best

•🎨 Full Color System

Instantly generate a complete color palette (from 50 to 900) based on your base colors.

•🔗 Semantic Color Mapping

Create semantic color variables that stay linked to your base palette.

•🌗 Light & Dark Theme Support

Effortlessly manage color values for both light and dark modes.

•🧰 Visual Color Editor

Tweak colors visually with a real-time preview — no guesswork required.

•📁 Clean, Organized Structure

Keeps your color variables tidy and consistent with logical naming and folders.

•🧩 Built for Design Tokens

Prism follows a token-based approach inspired by the Lumos Design System, making it easy to plug into any design system workflow.


⸻


Prism helps you focus on what matters — great design — by handling the complexity of color systems behind the scenes. Perfect for design systems, large projects, or anyone who wants a more organized Figma file.
plugins.tagline: Color token management designed to power the Lumos Design System.

128317.name: Prism by lumos
128317.description:
🌈 Prism by Lumos


A smarter way to manage your Figma color variables


Prism is a powerful, easy-to-use plugin built to help you create, organize, and maintain a clean, scalable color system in Figma. Whether you’re building from scratch or refining an existing system, Prism takes the heavy lifting out of color management.


It’s the same powerful tool we use to power the Lumos Design System — with token-based color management built right in.


⸻


✨ What Prism does best

•🎨 Full Color System

•🔗 Semantic Color Mapping

plugins.name: Numeric Variable Checker
plugins.description:
Numeric Variable Checker は、Figma上で数値のハードコーディング（Variablesが適用されていない数値）を検出し、一覧で確認できるプラグインです。


対象は、padding・spacing・width・height・cornerRadius・strokeWeight などの数値プロパティ。


Variablesが未適用の数値だけを抽出し、親子階層を含めて再帰的にチェック。

該当のフレームにはワンクリックでジャンプできます。


-


Numeric Variable Checker is a Figma plugin that helps you detect and list raw numeric values in your design—such as padding, spacing, width, height, corner radius, and stroke weight—that are not yet connected to Variables.


Whether you're building a design system or refining your layout for scalability, this plugin ensures your numbers are consistent, maintainable, and tokenized.


It recursively scans all selected frames and their children, highlights unbound values, and lets you jump to each frame with one click.
plugins.tagline: For designs that stay consistent down to the pixel.

126488.name: Numeric Variable Checker
126488.description:
Numeric Variable Checker は、Figma上で数値のハードコーディング（Variablesが適用されていない数値）を検出し、一覧で確認できるプラグインです。


対象は、padding・spacing・width・height・cornerRadius・strokeWeight などの数値プロパティ。


Variablesが未適用の数値だけを抽出し、親子階層を含めて再帰的にチェック。

該当のフレームにはワンクリックでジャンプできます。


-


Numeric Variable Checker is a Figma plugin that helps you detect and list raw numeric values in your design—such as padding, spacing, width, height, corner radius, and stroke weight—that are not yet connected to Variables.


Whether you're building a design system or refining your layout for scalability, this plugin ensures your numbers are consistent, maintainable, and tokenized.


It recursively scans all selected frames and their children, highlights unbound values, and lets you jump to each frame with one click.
126488.tagline: For designs that stay consistent down to the pixel.

With access to hundreds of unique shapes, you can create an endless variety of patterns tailored to your needs. Easily control tiling and pattern variety to achieve the perfect design, whether you're creating backgrounds, UI elements, or other graphic assets.


Customize colors and shape selections to match your vision, and export your patterns in high-quality PNG or SVG vector formats for use in web, app, and product designs.

plugins.name: PureImage Export
plugins.description:
PureImage Export saves you the hassle of removing Corner radius and Effects when exporting images in Figma. With this plugin, you can easily export optimized images without the need for manual adjustments.


PureImage Export Features

🧹 Remove Corner Radius & Effects

🔍 Preview Display

📁 Bulk Download Multiple Layers


How to Use:

  1. Select the layer with a Corner radius or Effects applied.
  2. Set up the export (default settings work fine too).
  3. Execute the PureImage Export.
  4. Set the Corner radius/Effects and click [Export as [file format]].


Recommended For:

  1. Anyone who needs to export optimized images from Figma for web development.
  2. Web designers and frontend developers who want to easily export and import images from Figma.
plugins.tagline: Export optimized images from Figma without removing corner radius or effects!

125876.name: PureImage Export
125876.description:
PureImage Export saves you the hassle of removing Corner radius and Effects when exporting images in Figma. With this plugin, you can easily export optimized images without the need for manual adjustments.


PureImage Export Features

🧹 Remove Corner Radius & Effects

🔍 Preview Display

📁 Bulk Download Multiple Layers


How to Use:

  1. Select the layer with a Corner radius or Effects applied.
  2. Set up the export (default settings work fine too).
  3. Execute the PureImage Export.
  4. Set the Corner radius/Effects and click [Export as [file format]].


Recommended For:

  1. Anyone who needs to export optimized images from Figma for web development.
  2. Web designers and frontend developers who want to easily export and import images from Figma.
125876.tagline: Export optimized images from Figma without removing corner radius or effects!
